name: transport, passenger train, high-speed | transport, passenger train | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3890/documentation

The dataset represents the entire transport life cycle of high-speed passenger train in France. Data of energy use and operation emissions refers to conditions in Germany (ICE-train): Particulate emissions due to abrasion of rail tracks, wheels, brakes and overhead contact line is included. Emission of sulphur hexafluoride (SF6) occurring during conversion at traction substations are accounted for.

The dataset starts with the production of a high-speed train.

The dataset ends with the service of transporting 1 passenger over a distance of 1 km by a high-speed train. The dataset includes the production, the maintenance and the energy use and operation emissions of a high-speed train, the construction of a railway track. The inventory of energy use and operation emissions includes the actual energy consumption due to traction and operations on board.
category: H:Transportation and storage/49:Land transport and transport via pipelines/491:Transport via railways/4911:Passenger rail transport, interurban

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data refers to operation of a high speed train in France. Specific energy use and operation emissions refers to the operation of a German ICE, the train is operated with the french electricity mix. Airborne emission data is extrapolated from Swiss conditions.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Demand factors of various transport components required to fulfill the functional unit of one pkm. In order to account for the fact that the same rail tracks are used for both passenger and goods transportation are applied allocation factors. For the energy use and operation emisisons data, the operation of the highspeed train is assumed with the german ICE high speed train.
